Key Match Events: South Africa defeated the United States by 18 runs in the first T20 World Cup Super 8 game in Antigua.
Kagiso Rabada took three vital wickets, finishing with figures of 3-18.
Quinton de Kock scored 74 runs and was named player of the match.
De Kock reached his half-century in 26 balls and shared a 110-run partnership with Aiden Markram.
Harmeet Singh dismissed Quinton de Kock and David Miller in consecutive deliveries.
Heinrich Klaasen scored a quick-fire 36 in an unbroken 53-run partnership with Tristan Stubbs.
US opener Andries Gous scored 80 not out.
Rabada dismissed Steven Taylor, Nitish Kumar, and Harmeet Singh.
US captain Aaron Jones was dismissed for a duck by Keshav Maharaj.
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock mentioned the importance of spending time in the middle after tricky wickets in previous games.
US captain Aaron Jones expressed disappointment over the defeat, emphasizing the need for more disciplined bowling.
